name: icon-fonts
description: Atom snippets for a variety of icon fonts
readme:
# Icon Fonts for Atom [![apm](https://img.shields.io/apm/l/icon-fonts.svg?style=flat-square)](https://atom.io/packages/icon-fonts) [![apm](https://img.shields.io/apm/v/icon-fonts.svg?style=flat-square)](https://atom.io/packages/icon-fonts) [![apm](https://img.shields.io/apm/dm/icon-fonts.svg?style=flat-square)](https://atom.io/packages/icon-fonts) [![Travis](https://img.shields.io/travis/idleberg/atom-icon-fonts.svg?style=flat-square)](https://travis-ci.org/idleberg/atom-icon-fonts) [![David](https://img.shields.io/david/dev/idleberg/atom-icon-fonts.svg?style=flat-square)](https://david-dm.org/idleberg/atom-icon-fonts#info=devDependencies) Atom snippets for a variety of icon fonts ([see details](#prefixes)). Converted from the [package](https://github.com/idleberg/Icon-Fonts-Sublime-Text) for Sublime Text. ## Installation ### apm * Install package `apm install icon-fonts` (or use the GUI) ### GitHub 1. Change directory `cd ~/.atom/packages/` 2. Clone repository `git clone https://github.com/idleberg/atom-icon-fonts icon-fonts` ## Usage Snippets are limited to the `.text.html` scope. Typing the class name of an icon using the designated prefix will complete to a tag containing the icon class. Exceptions are `fa-stack` (``) and `fa-ul` (`
    `). ### Prefixes Prefix | Icon Font | Version | cdnjs | jsDelivr ---------------|-----------|---------|-------|--------- `ai` | [Android Icons](http://www.androidicons.com/) | 1.0.0 | ðŸš« | ðŸš« `brandico` | [Brandico Font](https://github.com/fontello/brandico.font) | â€“ | ðŸš« | ðŸš« `cc` | [Creative Commons Icon Font](http://cc-icons.github.io/) | 1.2.1 | âœ… | âœ… `devicons` | [Devicons](https://github.com/vorillaz/devicons) | 1.8.0 | âœ… | âœ… `el-icon` | [Elusive Icons](http://shoestrap.org/downloads/elusive-icons-webfont/) | ? | ðŸš« | ðŸš« `fa` | [Font Awesome](http://fontawesome.io/) | 4.4.0 | âœ… | âœ… `fi` | [Foundation Icons](http://zurb.com/playground/foundation-icons) | 3.0 | âœ… | âœ… `filetypes` | [Glyphicons Filetypes](http://glyphicons.com/) | 1.9.0 | ðŸš« | ðŸš« `foundico` | [Foundation Icons](https://github.com/zurb/foundation-icons/tree/original-implementation) | 1.0 | ðŸš« | ðŸš« `geomicon` | [Geomicons Open](https://github.com/jxnblk/geomicons-open/) | 2.0.0 | ðŸš« | âœ… `glyphicons` | [Glyphicons Pro](http://glyphicons.com/)* | 1.9.0 | ðŸš« | ðŸš« `halflings` | [Glyphicons Halflings](http://glyphicons.com/) | 1.9.0 | ðŸš« | ðŸš« `ion` | [Ionicons](https://github.com/driftyco/ionicons) | 2.0.1 | ðŸš« | ðŸš« `line` | [Elegant Theme Line Icons](http://www.elegantthemes.com/blog/resources/how-to-use-and-embed-an-icon-font-on-your-website) | â€“ | ðŸš« | ðŸš« `mfg` | [MFG Labs Iconset](http://mfglabs.github.io/mfglabs-iconset/) | â€“ | ðŸš« | ðŸš« `octicon` | [GitHub Octicons](https://octicons.github.com/) | 3.3.0 | ðŸš« | ðŸš« `oi` | [Open Iconic](https://useiconic.com/open/) | 1.1.0 | ðŸš« | âœ… `openwebicons` | [OpenWeb Icons](http://pfefferle.github.io/openwebicons/) | 1.3.2| ðŸš« | ðŸš« `pf` | [PaymentFont](http://paymentfont.io/) | 1.1.2 | âœ… | ðŸš« `ratchicon` | [Ratchicons](http://goratchet.com/components/#ratchicons) | 2.0.2 | âœ… | âœ… `social` | [Glyphicons Social](http://glyphicons.com/) | 1.9.0 | ðŸš« | ðŸš« `st` | [Stack Icons](http://stackicons.com/) | 1.0.0 | ðŸš« | ðŸš« `typicon` | [Typicons](http://typicons.com/) | 2.0.7 | ðŸš« | ðŸš« `ui` | [Semantic UI Icons](http://semantic-ui.com/elements/icon.html) | 2.0.7 | âœ… | âœ… `zmdi` | [Material Design Iconic Font](https://github.com/zavoloklom/material-design-iconic-font) | 2.2.0 | âœ… | ðŸš« \* Vanilla Glyphicons and Bootstrap Glyphicons use different class-names, the former adding a plural-s to its classes. On completion, a tab-stop is added to support both options. Future versions will deprecate this distinction, since [Bootstrap 4](http://blog.getbootstrap.com/2015/08/19/bootstrap-4-alpha/) is likely to ship without (glyph)icons. Examples: * `fa-check`+Tab completes to `` * `glyphicons-check`+Tab completes to `` * `octicon-check`+Tab completes to `` * well, you get the idea ### CDNs If a supported CDN is indicated in the [table](#prefixes) above, you can use the prefixes `cdnjs` or `jsdelivr` to quickly insert a link to the CDN-hosted asset: Examples: * `cdnjs-fa`+Tab completes to a `` tag to the Font Awesome style-sheet * `jsdelivr-fa`+Tab completes to a `` tag to the Font Awesome style-sheet * `jsdelivr-geomicon`+Tab completes to a `
